titles.title: S Corporation Investment Act of 1994
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to modify certain rules relating to subchapter S corporations.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 8/1/1994--Introduced. S Corporation Investment Act of 1994 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to increase from 35 to 40 the maximum number of shareholders of an S Corporation (small business corporation). Allows members of a family to be treated as one shareholder. Increases the percentage of permissible passive income. Allows a deduction for payments made to a reinvestment reserve with limitations.
